_header: Our glorious Father that art in heaven
_description: John Lydgate, paraphrase of the Pater Noster — seven rhyme royal stanzas with Latin refrain in stanzas 1-6

CamTCC601.First Lines:
oure glorious ffadyr þat art in heueneKepe vs þy chyldre
                    þat þow hast wroughtGraunt vs these petycions seueneAs thy
                    son taught þat hath vs bought…
CamTCC601.Last Lines:
…And gracious ffadyr take no vengeaunceSed libera nos a
                        malo
CamTCC601.Note:
Nine 8-line stanzas, ababbcbc including Latin eighth line, ‘O
                        pater noster qui es in celis’ (stanzas 1-8) and ‘Sed
                        libera nos a malo’ (stanza 9).
CamTCC601.Attributed Title:
Hic sequitur Oracio dominica per dominum Iohannem lydegate translata
                    (f. 274ra)
CamTCC601.Editions:
Mahir,  Otto,
                        ed.  
             Eine religiöse Gedichte John Lydgates.
         Oberviechtach: Adolf Mahir, 1910: 16-18.
MacCracken,  Henry Noble,
                        ed.  
             John Lydgate: The Minor Poems, Vol. I: Religious Poems.
EETS
         e.s. 107 (1911; repr. 1961): 18-20.

Longleat30.First Lines:
Glorious fader þat art in heuenkepe vs þi childer that
                    thow has wrouȝt…
Longleat30.Last Lines:
…kepynge oure wittes and thy hestes tenAnd gracious fader take
                    no vengaunceSed libera nos a malo Amen
Longleat30.Note:
The rubric ‘Pater noster qui es in celis’ follows
                    every stanza but the last.
Longleat30.Attributed Title: Here begynneth þe Pater noster in englys (f. 24)

HunHM142.First Lines:
Glorious fader þat art in heuenKepe us þi childer
                    þat þou has wrouȝt…
HunHM142.Last Lines:
…Kepynge oure wittes and þi hestes tenAnd gracious fader
                    take no uengeaunceSet libera nos a malo amen
HunHM142.Attributed Title: Here begynneth the Pater noster in englys (f. 20v)
